thread.title: Jose Mourinho insists Manchester United will pick strong side for FA Cup clash at Chelsea
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho insists Manchester United will pick strong side for FA Cup clash at Chelsea

author: James Whaling
title: Jose Mourinho insists Manchester United will pick strong side for FA Cup clash at Chelsea
text:
Sport Jose Mourinho insists Manchester United will pick strong side for FA Cup clash at Chelsea “We have to keep the two doors open,” said Mourinho following United's 1-1 draw against FC Rostov in Russia Share Mourinho has revealed his plans for Chelsea (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United will pick a strong side for their FA Cup clash at Chelsea despite the air miles they will rack up travelling back from Russia, insists boss Jose Mourinho. 
The Red Devils are due to land in the UK in the early hours of Friday morning after drawing 1-1 with FC Rostov in the first leg of their last-16 Europa League tie on Thursday evening. 
They will have just a couple of days to prepare for the trip to Stamford Bridge on Monday evening for the quarter-final as they look to add to their trophy haul following victory in the EFL Cup final against Southampton. 
And the second leg against Rostov will take place just three days after the Chelsea fixture. Mkhitaryan gave United the lead in Russia (Photo: REUTERS) Bukharov netted the leveller (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Jose Mourinho hails Manchester United's performance on 'awful' Rostov pitch: ''It was impossible to play better'' 
“We have to keep the two doors open,” Mourinho said. “We need to keep going in the Premier League and, if you are in the quarter final, we would feel the door is open to us in the Europa League. We have to try by every means. 
“We have a trophy in our pocket and that is a good feeling for everybody. 
"I know we have to beat Rostov at Old Trafford to reach the quarter-finals but we cannot go with a Nicky Butt team because last season Manchester United was the winner of the competition.” poll loading Who will progress to the FA Cup semi-finals? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
